website_summaries.verdict: Lace-up hiking boot with speed-hook hardware featuring breathable mesh panels.
pros: Ideal lace-up hiking shoe for all weather conditions
GORE-TEX waterproof lining keeps feet warm
Gusseted tongue keeps dirt and debris from entering the shoe
cons: Insole might feel a little thin

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding lightweight multifunctional boot
customer_reviews.text: After putting over 200 Miles on them I feel like I can talk about these boots a little bit. First off they are the most comfortable boot I've owned, glove-like fit. They are super lightweight compared to most hiking/backpacking boots out there, just a bit heavier that a trail running shoe without sacrificing stability. Totally waterproof, the only moist that builds up inside them is because of my profusely sweaty feet. The grip is ok, I prefer Vibram all day long but they get the job done. Breathability is pretty decent, it's getting HOT out here in Texas so we'll see how they behave in temperatures over 100 degrees. Overall you can't go wrong with these, they're just awesome!
customer_reviews.author: Wesley Soto

customer_reviews.title: Salomon rules. Amazing quality for a totally fair price.
customer_reviews.text: Seriously the best footwear I have ever owned for any activity. Waterproof, durable as hell and light/springy. They fit like they were custom made (although that's an assumption as I've never had anything custom made before). I worked at a country club over the summer and had to mow grass at super-dangerous angles where slipping would result in anything from total embarrassment all the way up to serious injury. These things grip like they're for climbing freakin mountains. When you see the traction pattern on the bottom, you'll see why. I had some Salomon snowboard gear when I was a kid and it was good stuff but I forgot how good. Worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Z. Roberts

customer_reviews.title: Got tired of Merrell declining quality, these seem to be a decent replacement.
customer_reviews.text: I've had I don't know how many pairs of Merrell Chameleons over the years. I always loved them, but the quality has severely declined over the past few years. They just literally fall apart in half the time they used to. So I gave Salomon a shot. They are slightly narrower in the toe than the Merrells I'm used to, but still good. Rubbed one little toe for the first couple of days of break in, but now fit comfortably. Time will tell if these last very long.
customer_reviews.author: Midwest Misfit

customer_reviews.title: Great looking! Incredibly uncomfortable
customer_reviews.text: Love the look of these boots. I was excited to receive them especially during the winter months. I gave these boots 9 months before I put them away. I have a few screws in my right knee from a torn acl/meniscus several years ago. These boots are quick to fill my entire body with excruciating pain. I'm a shoe collector of all varieties. None of my other shoes give me pain like these boots. I'm extremely disappointed. Additionally, I have tried several shoe inserts and most definitely feel the boot is the contributor.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic boot! Buy with confidence.
customer_reviews.text: Great shoe. Very much water proof. Have put a lot of miles on these now as I have had them for quite some time and they are fantastic. They are super durable and have great grip on them. They breathe well in warmer weather, and with the right sock they will keep your feet warm in the colder weather. Fit's well. I wear a 10 running shoe, got these in a 10 and they fit great. I have pretty wide feet and these are definitely better for wide feet people I'd say.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Pinero

customer_reviews.title: Amazon's wonderful & easy return helped us get another pair overnighted ...
customer_reviews.text: I am writing this for my husband who has been on multiple backpack, hiking trips. My first order had one boot that was defective. Amazon's wonderful & easy return helped us get another pair overnighted as I had a 25 mile, two night hike in just two days. These broke in quickly & were wonderful! For the first time, I didn't have any pain or discomfort with our long hikes. These kept my feet warm & dry even though we went through mud, puddles, & creeks. The only time my feet got wet was when water went over my boot through a river. The toe box was big which was great for my wider foot. I highly recommend these.
customer_reviews.author: MommaD

customer_reviews.title: Totally Dope
customer_reviews.text: These are rad, best shoes I've bought. Good for tricky warehouse for, good for keeping pace but can also take some damage that might ruin other shoes. Personally I work in a small warehouse where you regularly have to watch your footing. And climb every so often. So a hiking shoe is pretty good. Traction is A-1, feels pretty light but durable. Had em a few months now and I've definitely beat them up but they hold up better than most shoes. I'de definitely suggest them for anyone hiking or just having any rough shoe related activities. Except people who drag their feet. People who drag their feet are not worthy of shoes.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: Marine approved.
customer_reviews.text: The best hiking shoes on the market. Fits my feet like a glove, has amazing traction, waterproof, and very durable. Ten years as a recon marine means I have tried every boot or shoe out there for use in the worst conditions with heavy loads. These shoes are top performers. I have bought several pairs just in case the Salomon goes crazy and stops making them.
customer_reviews.author: Brian P.

customer_reviews.title: WATERPROOF and very comfortable.
customer_reviews.text: Supportive, good grip, and they ARE waterproof. I don't know what the other reviewers are talking about but these boots are in fact waterproof. In order to maintain dryness the user has to ensure the tounge is properly seated in the boot and laces are tied to the top clasp. I haven't had the boots long so I can't determine the durability, but upon initial fit and feel these boots are a winner. The quality is top notch and there is nothing that feels cheap about these boots. Buy with confidence!
customer_reviews.author: KIngjames

customer_reviews.title: the nikes i went true size 10's a lil tight but broke in good so went 10
customer_reviews.text: just arrived so of course this review is brief, can't go wrong with amazons service.. arrived in 2 days, nike airs, asics and these guys ordered within a few months. the nikes i went true size 10's a lil tight but broke in good so went 10.5's for the asics and these both fit perfect! go a half size bigger and you are good to go. buying shoes online can be a little hectic these fell great, even bought some socks for em.. can't wait to test em out in my ole 4 day weekend thanksgiving campathon with the family. :) very pleased how these feel straight out of the box.
customer_reviews.author: kalash

customer_reviews.title: Hard to go wrong with Salomon on your feet.
customer_reviews.text: Salomon does a good job. Myself, I'm on a walking quest of 25,000 miles in my 70's. I'm 78 and nearing the 23,000 mile marker. I've gone thru 3 pair of the Salomon Synapse. I'm on my second pair of Salomon X-Ultra. I've gone thru four pair of the Salomon XA Comp 7 or similar. I've also gone thru 3 or 4 pair of Nike Pegasus. I stay with Salomon because of the fit, weight & durability. Happy feet make for a happy body. My feet are happy with Salomon.
customer_reviews.author: CatManDo

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable and not too hot
customer_reviews.text: Comfortable and not too hot, like some hiking shoes. I broke them in over the course of a couple months. I then wore them on a 50-mile hike and did get a blister on the inside of each of my feet. Another guy I was with got blisters in the same spot. Perhaps both of our feet are oddly shaped in that spot. Regardless, I’m doing another 50-mike hike again soon and have no reservations about wearing these shoes again. This time I will probably bring extra moleskin.
customer_reviews.author: Traxbe

customer_reviews.title: Overall great boots just order a half size smaller than your normal.
customer_reviews.text: Somewhat large. I ordered a 11.5 which is what I wear in Danner, 5.11, Bates, and many other boots but this was just a bit too large. The boot was as comfortable as you can get I returned them and ordered a 11. I have been wearing them for about 3 weeks and they are VERY comfortable boots with no break in period which is very nice. overall I think they are excellent boots and would highly recommend them, just order a half size smaller.
customer_reviews.author: DUSTIN

customer_reviews.title: Love em, new favorite shoe/boot
customer_reviews.text: I really love these shoes. They are great for spring/summer and 100% waterproof, i've stood in the middle of streams for a few minutes and not a drop inside. Ankle support is great but not cumbersome like a full boot. The best way to describe them is a boot in a running shoe cut. They are extremely light and have aggressive soles for rough terrain, solid arch support, and feel very light and nimble on the feet.
customer_reviews.author: bk

customer_reviews.title: Capacious heel box
customer_reviews.text: Despite having to return this item (read further), I love the comfort of a Salomon Boot and previously have had several. Because of recent injuries, I have a challenging foot to fit and returned this because the heel box is simply too big, an observation made by other experienced hikers. The toe box and instep, however, are extremely comfortable. I likely could have kept the shoe and used extra padding in the form of an additional hiking sock, but having found a manufacturer (Oboz) that specializes in D width toe boxes with B width heel boxes, chose the Oboz instead.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Better than most..
customer_reviews.text: These boots are fantastic for folks with long toes. For once someone is designing shoes with plenty of room toe movement . in addition the tongue is gusseted to keep rock and water out. Yes they water proof. These are more comfortable than Danner, wolverine, Georgia, Rocky, and even the expensive water proof Ariat. It seems that the boot holds my foot back in the boot better limiting /preventing the calluses and blisters and sore toes. Also the heel is orthotic and better that of inserts. size 13 fits perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Bill Mitchell

customer_reviews.title: Not good on any type of rock.
customer_reviews.text: I've had these boots for two years. For most of that time, they have lived in the garage as my lawn mowing boots. As other reviewers have mentioned, the soles of these boots are so slippery on any form of rock or rock slab, they are dangerous. If the rock is wet, you are better off barefooted. If you need a well fitting boot to mow the lawn, buy these. Otherwise, go with something with a vibram sole.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight and waterproof!
customer_reviews.text: I have a "flat feet" and I felt the arch support right away. However, after breaking them in and replacing my the inlays with my foot orthotics, these fit perfectly. They are super lightweight and provide fantastic ankle support. They are also completely waterproof. I ended up in a creek in sub 30 degree temperatures, hiked for 2 more hours, and my feet were completely dry. So far, I highly recommended and would buy again. Testing them out in Iceland in 2 weeks, so I''ll update on their performance then.
customer_reviews.author: Optimus Prime

customer_reviews.title: Best overall shoe I've ever worn
customer_reviews.text: I live in Sioux Falls, SD and I use these daily when it's raining, snowing for anything and everything. They're very well built, and 100% waterproof. When it's really cold and you're walking through snow, your feet may get a little cold but they will stay dry. You might want to choose the insulated option if you are looking for something more warm. If you are looking for shoe to take to the shooting range, I'd recommend the low top version as opposed to the mid. I will definitely choose Salomon again in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Mike C.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for an adventurous traveler
customer_reviews.text: Unnnng these shoes were absolutely essential for my 6-country world tour filled with hiking and climbing. I wanted a pair of shoes that I could use not just for serious hiking but also for every day wear. I needed a one-shoe-fits-all. This was it from the moment I put it on my foot. Wonderful comfort, and extra ankle support for the hiking. Durable - and believe me they took a beating during my travels. 10/10 would buy again. As with any shoe, you will have to break it in a little. I had some beginnings of blisters for the first week or two. But then smooth sailing.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love Salomon. Great for hiking
customer_reviews.text: Love Salomon. Great for hiking, but the tread wears quite quickly if you would want to wear them daily on asphalt for whatever reasons I would not recommend. But in the Alps they are a blessing. A bit warm, but I have naturally hot feet. Gore tex works good so far though I wouldn't want to step in a deep puddle and fully submerge them. Great support. Takes about 3-4hrs a day for 2-3 days to break in properly so give yourself time before going straight on a 9hr hicke
customer_reviews.author: Dubso

customer_reviews.title: ... Men's X Ultra Mid 2 GTX is a very comfortable mid boot but still in the break-in stage
customer_reviews.text: The Salomon Men's X Ultra Mid 2 GTX is a very comfortable mid boot but still in the break-in stage. So far so good. Like the feel, look, and how it laces up. Have been on a wet hike and they kept my feet dry. Like the tread pattern on the boot. Grabs climbing and holds on the down slope. Salomon puts out quality and I would recommend this boot to a friend.
customer_reviews.author: BGharvest

customer_reviews.title: Solid hiking boot - they are definitely waterproof!
customer_reviews.text: I am obsessed with these hiking shoes. I am newer to hiking in general, but purchased these boots for a week-long trip to the Chilean Patagonia. I pretty much submerged these boots in water ENTIRELY, and they are definitely WATERPROOF. They were also incredibly comfortable - I had multiple days of hiking for 12+ hours consecutively, and I cannot stress how comfortable they were. They seem pretty light-weight, great support, solid traction on all sorts of terrain. I am very pleased with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Andy

customer_reviews.title: Too narrow
customer_reviews.text: Until Salomon gets with the times and starts making their boots with a wide option, I'll stick with my Merrells. This boot wasn't super uncomfortable, but as someone who spent years in the Infantry, and now in my LE career, I know how crucial good footwear is to the mission. Definitely impressed with their quality, but quality doesn't keep your feet happy when the boots smashing the sides of your feet together.
customer_reviews.author: Stringer

customer_reviews.title: unfortunately I didn't realize how bad it was until I'd thrown away the box and ...
customer_reviews.text: The forefoot is very narrow and, unfortunately I didn't realize how bad it was until I'd thrown away the box and decided to keep them. I can't wear them because the hurt so bad. I've never worn anything but standard width shoes and they don't offer a wide (er) version on this one. Salomon has great quality, lightness, durability, breathability and water resistance, but this one was a fail.
customer_reviews.author: Terry Wadkins

customer_reviews.title: Solid hiking boot
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent light hiking boot. I haven't tested the water resistance but according to the description there is a water resistant liner. It seems to be comfortable and durable and the grip is terrific. I've done about 20 miles with of hiking on these and the support is excellent and my feet don't feel any effect from the hikes. The only issue I have is the need to re-tie the strings on the boots with some frequency.
customer_reviews.author: Jesse Weidman

customer_reviews.title: This is an excellent sneaker/boot. Great for doing everything short of carrying ...
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent sneaker/boot. Great for doing everything short of carrying 30 lbs for 10 days (and might be great for that too, haven't tried yet). But if you are doing 2-4 days trips and know how to pack light this is all you'll ever need. I should have prefaced this review with the fact that I'm a big fan of Salomon. I regularly purchase there XA and XD trail running shoes and prior to these my boots where their more heavy duty hiking boots. This is a great combination of the two and as I wrote, work for most situations.
customer_reviews.author: Arthur A. Taylor Jr.

customer_reviews.title: This sucks! :(
customer_reviews.text: Well I Got these in Dec 2016 and I loved them. The problem is that the sole of the shoe is separating at the toe Box. It has been for a while but now they are trash pretty much. I was not super hard on these boots in fact they didn't touch dirt for a long time as I liked to wear them. They are not cheap boots so kind of sad that they failed. make sure to look at the pics. I could have cleaned them up but they are just dusty. gotta love AZ. You can see by the tread they were not that heavily used to separate.
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: Strange toe fabric behavior ruins these for me
customer_reviews.text: I want to like these boots, but I dont. They are lightweight and comfortable. Unfortunately the way the fabric behaves over the toe area drives me nuts. It's hard to describe but with each step it folds and makes a popping sound. It might seem like a small thing but I am probably going to be replacing these. Unfortunately I've had them too long to get my money back. I figured the fabric would relax and this would go away, but it didn't.
customer_reviews.author: Russ

customer_reviews.title: Painful tongue
customer_reviews.text: The edges of the tongue where it wraps around your ankle are kind of hard. For me, the tongue wraps deep around my ankle when I pull the laces tight, and the hard edges quickly start to hurt as they dig into the front of my ankles. Salomon's Evasion Mid, for example, has a much softer tongue that compresses and doesn't have this issue.
customer_reviews.author: shrap

customer_reviews.title: Awesome material but poor fit
customer_reviews.text: I really want to keep these as they are super lightweight and seem well constructed. However like some of the other reviewers I find them to be a bit too narrow (and I don’t have particularly wide feet) and to have excessive arch support (I have very high arches). Sad to return because the material is of high quality.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen Akerson

customer_reviews.title: One boot rubs painfully.
customer_reviews.text: One of the boots fits great and feels good. However, the other boot has something above the ankle that rubs painfully as I walk. I thought I would get used to it or that it would go away as I broke it in, but not so. I tried to massage that part to make it go away. I wanted to like these, but they are painful to wear.
customer_reviews.author: someone

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Practical, Stylish Boots
customer_reviews.text: Fits to size w two pairs Darn Tough sox on for winter. Very comfortable right out of box. Feel substantial, well-made, but also light/flexible almost like a running shoe. Very nice looking. These have been fine in the snow, but I will also buy true winter boots designed for extended times in snow, very low temps which I don’t believe these are designed or insulated for.
customer_reviews.author: Brian W

customer_reviews.title: Best shoe on the market.
customer_reviews.text: This is my second pair of this exact model. Not because the first pair wore out. They're still in great shape after 3 years of hard use. It's my second pair because if this model was ever discontinued I'd pay way too much to get another pair. Hands down, best boot/shoe on the market for any climate or terrain.
customer_reviews.author: D. Larson

customer_reviews.title: So far so good with heavy use
customer_reviews.text: Texas scrub brush and thorns, an unexpected drenching in salt water due to a rapidly rising high tide while hiking back through sandy mud, followed by snow in the mountains and wading through numerous creeks, plus just general walking 3 miles a day on paved and dirt paths. 6 months of pretty hard use and still just like new!
customer_reviews.author: DWB

customer_reviews.title: Not water resistant
customer_reviews.text: Do not buy these if you expect water resistant goretex. The first use of was through high grass after some rain, and they soaked through within an hour. I've never had a problem with Salomons until now, and I would return if the return window wasn't closed. Hopefully it's just a bad pair, but be warned.
customer_reviews.author: Nate

customer_reviews.title: Buying online tricky when it come to wearables!
customer_reviews.text: These hikers are awesome!! They fit my size 12 foot great. I went to Cabelas and tried on everything. They had and nothing felt like the New Balance 1520's that I have been hiking with for the last 7 years. It's to bad New Balance quit making them. These fit just like the 1520's did. They feel like a sneaker with all the added support you need to hike. I may buy another pair, just to have a back-up to these. Nice buy without trying them on 1st. Highly recommended!!
customer_reviews.author: Otto

customer_reviews.title: My husband says these are great and will probably get the low cut ones to ...
customer_reviews.text: We went to a sporting goods store to confirm the shoe size which was the size he always wears. The shoe was about $50 more there - showed the employee the price on Amazon and asked if they'd match and they declined. By the time we were at the car I had purchased them and they were there in 2 days. My husband says these are great and will probably get the low cut ones to wear during warmer months.
customer_reviews.author: rvrdonna

customer_reviews.title: Size is a bit too big
customer_reviews.text: Really nice shoes. Four stars because they are a bit big. I ordered a 9 because that is usually my size, I sometimes even wear 9.5. These are a bit too big, but it is not really worth the return hassle to go down a half size. The boots are very light and comfortable. The only real gripe I have is that they don't seem to have amazing grip, but that will not bother me as a casual hiker.
customer_reviews.author: bdepalo

customer_reviews.title: Best boots I've ever owned
customer_reviews.text: I want a new pair, not to say that they are worn out or falling apart, I just love them so much. They fit perfectly, I got these for a hiking trip and I did 23 miles in one day with no blisters, to be honest my feet felt better than most of me after. I now wear them for work and love them. I use to go through a pair of boots every 6 months or so with all the walking I do.
customer_reviews.author: Hobbs

customer_reviews.title: Great Boots
customer_reviews.text: I have taken these boots out on two 8 mile hikes. I really put them to the test on my last hike, by walking through muddy areas, streams and trekking up steep inclines. The only time my feet got the least bit wet was when I stepped in water higher than the boot, and even then it only let very little water into the boot. The boys were comfortable and fit very well. This is my first pair of Salomon's (Merrill before) and if the boots continue with this performance I don't see why I would ever buy anything else.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Willis

customer_reviews.title: Holy slipperyness, Batman!
customer_reviews.text: Like the shoes after 3 days but they are SUPER slick on wet stone/concrete surfaces. Seriously, a light rain on anything stone feels like I'm walking on ice. Sad because I bought the shoes for wet weather disc golf (waterproof) and almost all disc golf courses I play have concrete tee pads. I will NEVER wear these shoes when the weather is misty or rainy. Other than that, good shoes for dirt and grass.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon customer

customer_reviews.title: Good boot and trail tested.
customer_reviews.text: I only have a two day 32 mile hike on these, but they caused no blisters and felt very comfortable. The shoe does open up at the top as you step allowing in debris, I would suggest wearing a gator or a set of Dirty Girls. Plenty of cushion and support, I would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph M Sisson

customer_reviews.title: ... and broke them in they are some of the best hiking boots I've ever had
customer_reviews.text: I don't have wide feet but when I got these they were a little tight but now that I have wore them and broke them in they are some of the best hiking boots I've ever had. I've owned merrells and Keens and I love these. I even bought my girlfriend a pair and she loves them to!!
customer_reviews.author: William Michael Ward

customer_reviews.title: These boots are really nice. Compare to other boots I have had (Adidas
customer_reviews.text: These boots are really nice. Compare to other boots I have had (Adidas, Timberland, ARMY, BATES) these are lighter and material seems to be good. The size run a little bit larger so if buying consider that. 1/2 number less will be a good recommendation to be comfortable since the size run out almost 1 number larger. I have ware the whole day and although they are light and comfortable, there is something (some kind of boot support) at the ankle of the boot that after 4 hours starts aching you. That is why I give 4 starts. Besides that I will give these boots a 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good Job Salomon
customer_reviews.text: Good Job Salomon, Good Job This boot is greaaaaaat! I love it. first I bought 9.5, but based on my brother recommendation I got a little bigger 10 and returned the first one. your foot inside doesn't slide at all. You have a great control over your steps. protect your foot and finger excellent. after 5 hours hiking in Grand Canyon and 6 hours in Yosemite I can say you don't feel pressure at the bottom of your feet due to sharp stones and rocks. Besides, it is perfectly waterproof. Definitely recommended !!!
customer_reviews.author: Sajad

customer_reviews.title: Great buy!
customer_reviews.text: I had to drop a half size, but they're great boots and are very comfortable! Update: around a year later of wearing them daily and unfortunately during a trip to the boundary waters I noticed the toe was separating and let water in the boot, so definitely not waterproof anymore. Kind of sucked with it being in the 40's having wet feet. That being said I'd definitely buy another pair, up until they failed I was very happy with them.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent trail shoes
customer_reviews.text: Waited a while before I finally bought one. Was in doubt about the size but finally got a 1/2 size smaller and was happy I did. Fit was perfect! Good ankle support, excellent traction (Contagrip), good toe room (for my feet) and good insoles. These are really comfortable shoes. Felt like I was wearing a pair of basketball shoes.
customer_reviews.author: Walter

customer_reviews.title: These must be the most comfortable shoes I have ever had
customer_reviews.text: These must be the most comfortable shoes I have ever had. I have two pairs. I wear them for daily wear, hiking/camping, and work where I am on my feet in a shop for about 11 hours a day. Im sure some of their higher end boots are more comfortable but for the price these are amazing boots.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: The product arrived on time and in excellent condition. I recommend the seller
customer_reviews.text: The product arrived on time and in excellent condition. I recommend the seller. Product as described in Amazon's description, of excellent quality. The size of the shoe was expected. The shoe adjusts to the real size, they are comfortable, they look great and they are ready to be used.
customer_reviews.author: Carlos Medina Toaspern

customer_reviews.title: Great hiking and walking boot
customer_reviews.text: Great for hiking and daily use for those who walk 5+ miles for work. Only niggle is that it's sometimes hard to get the ankle area tight enough to avoid small rocks and debris from getting inside the foot area without cutting off circulation to the foot.
customer_reviews.author: --jl--

customer_reviews.title: Great hiking shoes
customer_reviews.text: These are perfect. They are great hiking shoes and are water proof. They are a little stiff at first but as soon as you break them in they are very comfortable. I would recommend these shoes to anyone looking for a sturdy and durable pair of hiking shoes.
customer_reviews.author: porte8a2

customer_reviews.title: great shoes
customer_reviews.text: this is my 4th pair of these..i put a lot of punishing mud filled miles on my hiking shoes. these fir out of the box..tho tend a little small..order a half size bigger..quite waterproof, comfortable and durable last and a decent tread..add it all together and i think these are the best light mid height rugged shoes out there
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Like others have said one of the boots makes a ...
customer_reviews.text: Like others have said one of the boots makes a weird noise when walking. For over $100 I expect decent quality, I've had them for three days and there already deteriorating. Edit: The noise has stopped and theyre holding togeather, as far as I can tell. Not sure about the water proof yet, havent been in the rain much. Back up to 4 stars unless they fall apart
customer_reviews.author: Susanne Barbour

customer_reviews.title: Sizing is off for this model, not sure why.
customer_reviews.text: I am a size 10 so I ordered that at first but size 10 ran too large. I then ordered the 9.5, but while the length felt right, the boots ran narrow. It hurt to wear them. I had to knock off one star for the the sizing problem. I have other Salomon shoes and they are great, but for some reason this pair of boots does not fit me. Real bummer.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Purchased for summer hiking/fishing in Alaska
customer_reviews.text: These are amazing boots. Extremely comfortable and require no breaking in. They fit perfectly and keep water out. I have zero complaints about this boot. Maybe I wish I would have bot the higher ones instead of the mid, but I would probably say the same about the mid if I bought the higher so I don't know. I will update if anything changes, but they performed perfectly for my weeklong trip in Alaska and I look forward to many more.
customer_reviews.author: Brocksley

customer_reviews.title: Super happy with these.
customer_reviews.text: I've had these since October and absolutely love them. I am the average outdoorsmen using them for hiking, camping, fishing, etc. They are really light, really comfortable, breathable and waterproof. I ended up buying my wife the low top women's version and she loves them too. Will for sure purchase again when needed.
customer_reviews.author: Blake L.

customer_reviews.title: He says they are comfortable, no chaffing
customer_reviews.text: Got these for my husband and he really likes them. He says they are comfortable, no chaffing, and have a decent grip. They are not too stiff and not too heavy. He started wearing them somewhat recently so it's hard to say how long they will last but he has been using them not only to hike but also to climb trees and rocks.
customer_reviews.author: B. Mamkegh

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight and comfortable--a good fit for narrow feet
customer_reviews.text: I first tried on a pair of Keen Targhee II boots because of the high ratings but they were way too wide for my 12.5B feet. Then I tried a pair of Merrells. Better, but still to wide. Then I tried these Salomons in size 13. Yes! With a thick pair of socks and a thin pair, the fit is nearly perfect. They're not much heavier than running shoes with much better ankle and sole support and better traction. I'm taking away 1 star because they're plasticy and stretchy. I have to stop often to cinch the laces up.
customer_reviews.author: jks

customer_reviews.title: Light, fast and protect ankles. However.. ...
customer_reviews.text: Light, fast and protect ankles. However... after a year of constant use the heel began to peel from the shoe. Some of this is due to the fact that my job is intensive but I would expect a Salomon shoe to hold up longer. I shoe glued it twice and it hasn't had any issues since since the 2nd gluing. However this do have some durability issues. comfort: 5/5 weight: 5/5 support: 4/5 durability: 3/5
customer_reviews.author: Roman

customer_reviews.title: which is pretty bad in a hiking shoe
customer_reviews.text: The shoes seemed to be well designed. Unfortunately, they seem to run small and narrow, which is pretty bad in a hiking shoe, as you are likely to wear heavier socks with it. I couldn't go a size up, because I was already topped out on their available sizes. I ended up returning them and buying a pair of Merrell MOAB 2s.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Bishop

customer_reviews.title: Love Solomon shoes!
customer_reviews.text: Used this show last couple months in Kansas winter. Went out 5/7 days a week fishing and hiking. Didn't use in deep snow or walk much in water but for snow cover trails, muddy trails, ice fishing and walking in the rain they have worked perfectly. If you are a fasting mover and want good traction, decent support, waterproof all in a light weight breathable package this will do the trick!
customer_reviews.author: julian lord

customer_reviews.title: Great hiking boot
customer_reviews.text: These shoes/boots are waterproof, lightweight, have a pretty good grip (not the greatest on ice). Look good. I'd rather have the shoelaces completely threaded to the top, but I'm becoming used to the "latch holes" at the very top. These were everything I expected. Now, I've only worn them twice -- once to a 170 foot stepped incline and to the grocery store, and once in the snowy rocky mountains in morrison, up about 800 feet. But I'm very pleased with them.
customer_reviews.author: paladisiac

customer_reviews.title: Great looking shoe and very supportive
customer_reviews.text: Great looking shoe and very supportive. I was somewhat concerned that they were too narrow initially. The length was fine but they seemed a bit tight width wise. I wore them to work for a day and went on two day hikes and I'm happy to say the loosened up just fine and are very comfortable now. I do recommend this boot for someone who wants a light weight hiking shoe that has good support, traction, and sharp looks. Just remember they do need a little break in for a comfortable fit.
customer_reviews.author: Tim G.

customer_reviews.title: SO GREAT!
customer_reviews.text: These shoes have been more than what I expected. Not only do they fit as expected, they have been killer on hikes that my wife and I do together. They are also great to wear to work if you stay on your feet often. During a recent hike with my wife, I rolled my ankle pretty bad.. If I were to have my other hiking shoes on that are low cut, my ankle would have been toast. SUPER pleased with these shoes. I would purchase them again in a heartbeat if something were to happen to them.
customer_reviews.author: Gunner Stewart

customer_reviews.title: The cut of the boot tends to be in a bad spot on your ankle
customer_reviews.text: Boot seems to be too narrow .. you need to pull the tongue out so the shoe is not tight against your ankles; otherwise, the shoe rubs the outside of your ankle bone. Boot could benefit from a higher profile. The cut of the boot tends to be in a bad spot on your ankle. I have narrow feet and skinny ankles ... feels like they could be a women's hiker instead of a male hiker. Haven't been on a long hike with them yet.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: My warm weather do everything shoe!
customer_reviews.text: This is my favorite do it all everday shoe in warm weather. It is very comfortable with good arch support & stability for my flat feet. Tread grip is outstanding and clears mud well. Gortex lining keeps feet dry but breazy in hot weather. I use it for hiking, camping, biking, walking, yard work, etc. Shoe is also lightweight and good looking. This is my fourth pair and second of this generation. I highly recommend this shoe.
customer_reviews.author: Jay

customer_reviews.title: Happy to wear them on long or wet hikes
customer_reviews.text: At first I was frustrated because the cushion dugged into my ankles causing a lot of discomfort during the break-in period. Thought I would return them. After settling, now they are comfy and stable. Happy to wear them on long or wet hikes.
customer_reviews.author: Ramon

customer_reviews.title: Salomon always delivers
customer_reviews.text: I always talk great about Salomon, from their shoes to their boots, they are all great. These are very comfortable, I wore these while in the military, wearing full kit/ruck, and they hold up to the abuse, and they are very easy to run in, they feel like running shoes, I've fast-roped these as well, no issues.
customer_reviews.author: DeltaSierra

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable and tough boots with good quality
customer_reviews.text: They are solid hiking boots, but much lighter and more comfortable than other leather boots. No water leakage after 1-year usage. These are exactly what I need.
customer_reviews.author: zhun zhu

customer_reviews.title: ... hiked maybe 25+ miles in these to date and love them. The first hike being about 15 miles ...
customer_reviews.text: I have hiked maybe 25+ miles in these to date and love them. The first hike being about 15 miles and my feet were not feeling the rocks until about the last mile and a half. This is my first pair of Salomon's and am impressed with the comfort. Haven't had any issues with traction either. Definitely recommend for a day hike shoe that is not to heavy but has a little bit of ankle support.
customer_reviews.author: Weston

customer_reviews.title: Squeaks every time I walk.
customer_reviews.text: They squeak every time I take a step. These are really expensive and am frustrated at the quality. I thought they'd eventually stop, but it has been 3 months. This is the 3rd pair I have bought and they are very expensive but if they didnt squeak I would be happy.
customer_reviews.author: S. Shores

customer_reviews.title: Break them in!
customer_reviews.text: Wear the right socks!!! Also, get used to them before hiking distances...I found that my heels blistered (because I wasn't wearing the correct socks) but also the front of my foot rubbed a little much and became real raw and red. Great tread! Perfect for sandstone bluffs that I work on daily! Size was also perfect. If you're going to be working in the sun, this black shoe isn't for you! But it's a great fit!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best Hiking Boot!
customer_reviews.text: Hands down the best out of hiking boots I’ve owned. I normally wear a 10, but had heard to get 1/2 size smaller, so I bought 9 1/2. That idea worked fine. I wear Rocky SV2 socks with the boots. Great fit. What I like; - Light Weight - Great fit - Comfortable walking several miles out of the box - No hot spots - Shoe laces stay tied - Great ankle support Cons; - Warm for hot weather but not overly so - The colors to choose from - A little tight on my small toes on both feet, but they are new... they should form to my feet with more use.
customer_reviews.author: RM

customer_reviews.title: Has noticeable arch support
customer_reviews.text: Shoe was very uncomfortable and narrow. There seem to be an arch support in the shoe which I did not see mentioned in the description. Overall quality was very good but it did not fit my foot good enough to keep.
customer_reviews.author: Carrie A.

customer_reviews.title: After two weeks of hiking developed a blister on both ...
customer_reviews.text: After two weeks of hiking developed a blister on both feet in exactly the same spot. The year before I had hiked over 1,000 km, same trails. without a blister with my other boots.
customer_reviews.author: William W. Radican

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe for me
customer_reviews.text: Great shoe for me. I walk 25 to 30 miles in my 40 hour work week. Most of it is concrete or pavement. I usually purchase upgraded insoles, but the thought hasn't crossed my mind wearing these shoes. Gor-tex is great for keeping your feet dry. Soles and uppers are holding up great. I will most definitely order these shoes again as well as check into insulated winter hiking boots.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony Rucinsky

customer_reviews.title: Second pair of Salomon
customer_reviews.text: Great shoe but still had to do some fine tuning for my feet. Had some excessive wear on the bottom but when you hike over 500 miles I not real sure that this is not common. While I was hiking the camino I saw a lot of this brand in a variety of styles.
customer_reviews.author: Bob

customer_reviews.title: Run small
customer_reviews.text: Shoe is well made but ran small and very narrow this is the second pair I've had to return for my husband because they run to small. He's went up a size and a half even. It's a shame I wear my correct size in ladies and have no issues. He does not have wide feet either.
customer_reviews.author: Elena Mikaelson

customer_reviews.title: Walking on air!
customer_reviews.text: Best pair of boots I have owned. These fit as expected and are comfortable all day. I walk 4 - 5 miles a day (according to my tracker) as a Facility Engineer and these boot are easy on the feet for 10 hours a day. They are nice and light not too warm in the Summer. I will update after the Winter. I have had Red Wings and Timberlands, but these are by far my favorite. Having been in boots for 24 years I just wish I found this brand sooner!
customer_reviews.author: MM

customer_reviews.title: Merrell Moab Mid GORE-TEX Boot,Dark Tan,13
customer_reviews.text: nice shoes. they are one size smaller then normal. the Merrell Moab Mid GORE-TEX Boot,Dark Tan,13 had more toe room then the salomom. they fell like a 12.5 not a 13
customer_reviews.author: BelieveMyreview

customer_reviews.title: and 2-3 in the toe box would be great. But if they fit
customer_reviews.text: Solomon's are famously narrow. Oddly they're the most narrow at the midfoot. An extra 1-2 mm in the mid foot, and 2-3 in the toe box would be great. But if they fit, you won't find a better constructed boot. Especially at this weight. Great foot support and lateral stability.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice boots. I tried on a pair at Cabelas ...
customer_reviews.text: Nice boots. I tried on a pair at Cabelas first to make sure I had the right size and then bought from Amazon. Very happy with the boot quality and comfort. Wore them on some mild trails, no complaints. I will update this review when I get some more trail time in.
customer_reviews.author: Jim H...

customer_reviews.title: The Best Yet.
customer_reviews.text: I love these shoes. I am a 63 yr old male, 6-1,195 lbs.of spring steel and rawhide. I have spent a small fortune on hiking boots and shoes of most brands. I bought the Saloman 4D Quest and found them to be wide and heavy clod hoppers. The Ultra Mid 2 is the best I have found for comfort with a light backpack, 25-30 lbs. I do use a custom arch support though. I wear them for casual shoes, knock around shoes, and for working at home, when safety toes are not needed. I have three pairs. I would like to try the military non-gortex model. Link
customer_reviews.author: John L. Martin

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable, questionable waterproofing
customer_reviews.text: These boots are very comfortable and only took a few days to break in. They are very light and feel very durable. My only complaint is that the waterproofing is quite poor. These boots are still great and I would recommend them since I most likely just got a pair with poor waterproofing applied. For the price, I can't complain. Another note: They do seem to run a little bit smaller, so I'd suggest trying them on in person first if you can.
customer_reviews.author: Alexander Kloska

customer_reviews.title: Salomon x ultra mid 2
customer_reviews.text: Light weight. Comfy. Durable out sole. Cons: insole is very weak, outsole is durable but may slip on some surfaces Still 4.5 to 5 stars for the built quality.
customer_reviews.author: san

customer_reviews.title: These were even more comfortable and look great
customer_reviews.text: I bought these shoes as an alternative to my heavier Salomon Quest 4d. I hike extensively in very rough Chihuahuan desert badlands. These were even more comfortable and look great. I am going to order another pair just for everyday use. The fit appears to be a little bit narrower, which suits my foot well.I couldn't be happier with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Ray Willis

customer_reviews.title: They fit perfect. Straight out of the box I wore them ...
customer_reviews.text: I'm a 10.5" in US mens sizing with typical width so I ordered the 10.5" size. They fit perfect. Straight out of the box I wore them for a 6 hour hike and didnt have any hot spots or blisters. I have about 50 hours on them now, and can still submerge my foot in water without having any water enter the shoe.
customer_reviews.author: MikeM

customer_reviews.title: Fabulous
customer_reviews.text: Out of the box. On to my feet. One hour break in. Went for a hike and they were everything I expected. These were recommended to me by my sons friend who wore these on a climb of Mt Kilimenjaro in Tanzania Africa. Sorry about the spelling.
customer_reviews.author: Viejo Majadero

customer_reviews.title: Great Boot
customer_reviews.text: Bought these at the recommendation of a friend. We're still friends! Very comfortable "work" boot. Light with great traction on almost anything, even wet steel decking. I haven't gotten them seriously wet yet so just 4 stars for now.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: comfortable right out of the box
customer_reviews.text: comfortable right out of the box. not hot spots or rubbing. a little warm but that to be expected (likely) do to being water proof. Dont lots of walking with not problems and the soles have excellent grip. two thumbs up!
customer_reviews.author: DJWinger

customer_reviews.title: Thought it would be wide enough, I was wrong.
customer_reviews.text: I have a wide foot, I could not find any wide hiking boots. I thought this would work. I can only wear them about 2 hours and it is not comfortable. I really like the look of this boot.. but the feel is what's important, and so far, it's not good.
customer_reviews.author: slviperdakota

customer_reviews.title: everyday and light hiking
customer_reviews.text: pros: very light. comfortable, but get at least .5 size larger to use thick socks. With regular socks, they will be snug. other: I got a pair sized for everyday use and light hiking so I can't wear my thickest hiking socks, but they seem like they will be warm enough for some cold weather in regular hiking socks. Need more time with it to see how all the seams and padding hold up after several months of use.
customer_reviews.author: raph

customer_reviews.title: Best hiking shoes I've ever owned After breaking in these ...
customer_reviews.text: Best hiking shoes I've ever owned After breaking in these boots in for about two weeks I just completed a three day hike in the Adirondacks. These boots out performed any boot I had previously owned. They kept my feet nice and dry under extreme muddy conditions and provided excellent ankle support. These boots were super lightweight and I look forward to putting many many more miles on them.
customer_reviews.author: FastAttackChief

customer_reviews.title: Good!
customer_reviews.text: Boot fits well, pretty comfortable. I've giving this pair a 4 out of 5 only because it does not let my foot breathe very well. Other than that, it is a very solid boot!
customer_reviews.author: William

customer_reviews.title: Comfort at its finest.... rugged at its core!
customer_reviews.text: Just got these In a few days ago. Let me tell you! They look much better in person than in the pictures. They are super comfortable and extremely well built. Tested it this last weekend on a 6 mile hike and they performed flawlessly. Did a few stream crossing and defiantly kept my feet dry. Just buy the quick lace system and they are a 10 out of 10
customer_reviews.author: Rvs83

customer_reviews.title: Great boot, just too narrow for me.
customer_reviews.text: Really love the solid build quality, great traction, flexibility and breath-ability. Too bad Salomon don't do 2E as I can see why some people say it fits narrow. Even by normal standard it leaves relatively few room around wider traverse arch and arch support, I think Salomon try to make it snug to compensate features that make it flexible and light-weight. Were it not for too narrow, I'd say this is the best balance I found and the "Multifunctional" name is well earned. Worth giving it a try though. Great boot. Salomon build a wide version, please.
customer_reviews.author: Niel Y.

customer_reviews.title: Love these boots
customer_reviews.text: Love these boots, after wearing the Solomon speed cross fours I decided to give their boots a chance and I am so glad I did. They are indeed waterproof and of high quality. They also clean up nicely to be worn around town
customer_reviews.author: William

customer_reviews.title: Like hiking on clouds.
customer_reviews.text: I've been hiking in these Salomons for 2 months and have to say they are the most comfortable hiking boots I've had. I even did trail running in them. I took a star off for durability as I alread tore the side of a boot doing aggressive hiking through rocks. All and all a great boot.
customer_reviews.author: John L Berlo

customer_reviews.title: I would recommend trying these boots on in stores before purchase
customer_reviews.text: I wear a size 8 in Nike shoes and these feel about the same in terms of length. Slightly wider than the Nike shoes(which can be narrow for some people). I would recommend trying these boots on in stores before purchase.
customer_reviews.author: S. Le

product_meta.title: Salomon Men's X Ultra Mid 2 GTX Multifunctional Hiking Boot
product_meta.description: Salomon was born in 1947 in the heart of the French Alps and the birthplace of modern alpinism. Driven by a passion for skiing and design innovation, Francois Salomon and his son George designed and perfected much of the first modern ski equipment. During the following 60 years, Salomon's commitment to innovative design and passion for mountain sports created a vast range of revolutionary new concepts in boots, skis and apparel and brought innovative solutions to footwear, apparel and equipment for hiking, adventure racing, mountaineering and trail running. Through performance-driven design, Salomon enhances mountain sports by converting new ideas into action and expanding the limits of possibility.
feature_bullets: Sensifit cradles the foot from the midsole to the lacing system, providing a secure, snug, and virtually customized fit all around the foot
